review: This replaced the feature on my Blu-ray which in turn, replaced my Roku. It is EXTREMELY fast at loading apps with very little wait. The previous methods could take a few minutes to access Netflix or Amazon Prime, but this is almost immediate. The voice feature is nice, but brings up many items under apps I do not subscribe to. My favorite feature is not having to hold the controller up and constantly pointing it at the box. I wish the cable and TV were so easy.
author: DTC

review: We don't have a smart TV, and this has made it much easier to watch Hulu, Netflix and Prime.  Overall it works well, was easy to set up, picture is very clear and lag is significantly reduced, but I do have some negative feedback.I had issues with the apps freezing, and had to restart the Fire TV to resolve it.  It seems to have gotten better or I am just not watching it as much as I did at first, so maybe it was just a matter of overuse.The games are pretty neat but I'm afraid that using the remote all the time will wear it out, and I just don't want to have to buy a controller for the money they are asking.  It also appears that not all of the games can be played with the controller, so really not sure it's worth it.My biggest complaint is with Prime content.  For $99 a year plus the cost of the Fire TV, really feel like there should be more available to watch for free.  Some of the movies that I have wanted to watch are quite a few years old and cost $2.99.  Also, a number of TV shows that are not available to watch or that must be purchased to watch with Prime are available on Hulu.  So it makes me think next year we may not renew it, even though there are other benefits, the main reason we got Prime was to watch instant videos.On a positive note, I am excited that HBO announced they will be available for streaming for a fee without a paid subscription through a cable carrier, and that Fire TV will support it.
